security_audit.summary: Standard development tooling for building React-based HTML artifacts. Scripts perform project scaffolding, npm package installation, and bundling operations. No network exfiltration, credential access, or obfuscation detected. Purpose matches capabilities.

content.user_title: Build complex HTML artifacts with React
content.value_statement: Creating elaborate HTML artifacts for Claude conversations requires modern frontend tooling. This skill provides automated scripts to initialize React projects with shadcn/ui and bundle them into single HTML files ready for artifact display.
actual_capabilities: Initialize React + Vite projects with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS
Install 40+ pre-built shadcn/ui components and dependencies
Configure path aliases and build tooling automatically
Bundle React apps into single self-contained HTML files
Create artifacts with state management and component libraries
limitations: Requires Node.js 18 or higher and pnpm package manager
Cannot be used with simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts
Does not include built-in artifact testing or visualization
Initial project creation requires tarball dependency file

best_practices: Use path aliases (@/) when importing components for cleaner code
Bundle artifacts only after development to avoid build overhead during iteration
Test artifacts locally with pnpm dev before bundling for Claude display
anti_patterns: Do not use for simple static HTML artifacts without React dependencies
Avoid bundling during active development - bundle only when ready to share
Do not skip the project initialization step when starting new artifacts

faq.question: What versions of Node.js are supported?
faq.answer: Node.js 18 or higher is required. The script auto-detects versions and pins Vite 5.4.11 for Node 18 compatibility.

faq.question: Can I use npm or yarn instead of pnpm?
faq.answer: The scripts require pnpm. You can convert projects to npm/yarn manually after initialization if needed.

faq.question: Is my artifact data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing happens locally. No data is sent to external servers beyond standard npm registry downloads.

faq.question: Why is my artifact file size large?
faq.answer: Bundled artifacts include all React, Tailwind, and component code. This is normal for complex artifacts.

faq.question: Can I customize the shadcn/ui theme?
faq.answer: Yes. Edit src/index.css to change CSS variables for colors, radius, and dark mode styles.

faq.question: How is this different from simple HTML artifacts?
faq.answer: This skill enables stateful applications with routing, complex components, and the full shadcn/ui library.
